intro: Cynoglossum semnanicum, commonly known as Persian mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to Iran. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, oval-shaped leaves and clusters of blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry soils and is adapted to arid environments. It is often found in mountainous regions and has a compact, low-growing habit. Cynoglossum semnanicum is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its aesthetic features.
